summary: An email from an FBI agent forwarding a report from retired agent Jeffrey Carrie about overhearing a conversation in a New Jersey bar regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death. Carrie reported two women discussing money sent to a Swiss bank account after Epstein's death, four BOP employees involved who could retire soon, and alleged procedural failures at the jail. Photos of the women were attached.

persons.name: Jeffrey Carrie
persons.role: Former FBI Agent, Director of Security & Emergency Management
persons.context: A retired FBI agent who overheard a conversation about the Epstein case at a bar and reported it, including taking photos of the women involved.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the overheard conversation; the women were discussing events surrounding his death.

connections.description: Carrie, a former FBI agent, reported overheard information pertaining to the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Conversation Overheard at De Novo Bar
events.description: Jeffrey Carrie overheard two women discussing the Epstein case, alleging money was sent to a Swiss bank account after his death, four BOP employees were involved, and there were procedural failures at the jail.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Referenced as the event after which money was allegedly sent to a Swiss bank account.

locations: Will Cornell Medical Center (Jeffrey Carrie's workplace)
keyFacts: A retired FBI agent reported overhearing a conversation where a woman alleged money was sent to a Swiss bank account following Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The same conversation alleged four Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employees were involved and could retire within a year.
The conversation cited procedural failures at the jail, including moving Epstein's cellmate and correctional officers not performing proper checks.
The retired agent took photographs of the women involved and their car's license plate for the FBI to vet.
